text: 2018–19 Senior Women's Challenger Trophy was the ninth edition of the women's List-A tournament in India. It was played from 3 January to 6 January 2019. The participating teams were India Blue Women, India Green Women and India Red Women. It was played in Round robin format and a final was played between top 2 teams. India Red defeated India Blue by 15 runs to win the Challenger Trophy for the 3rd time. == Squads == {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:15%;"| India Blue ! style="width:15%;"| India Green ! style="width:15%;"| India Red |- style="vertical-align:top" | * Punam Raut (c) * Priya Punia * Tanusree Sarkar * Bharti Fulmali * Aditi Sharma * Tamanna Nigam * Mansi Joshi * Reemalaxmi Ekka * Manali Dakshini * Tanuja Kanwar * G Trisha * Sushma Verma (wk) * Minnu Mani | * Mona Meshram (c) * Dayalan Hemalatha * Shafali Verma * Tejal Hasabnis * Anita Lodhi * Sneh Rana * Arundhati Reddy * Renuka Singh * Shubhlakshmi Sharma * Devyani Prasad * SB Keerthana * Sweta Verma (wk) * Sushree Dibyadarshini | * Shikha Pandey (c) * Neeragattu Anusha * Shivi Pandey * Veda Krishnamurthy * Vrushali Bhagat * Jasia Akhtar * Challa Jhansi Lakshmi * Komal Zanzad * Shannti Kumari * Radha Yadav * Harleen Deol * Ravi Kalpana (wk) * Tarannumbanu Pathan |} == Standings == {| class="wikitable" !Position !Team !Matches !Won !Lost !NR !Pts !NRR |- style="background-color:lightgreen" |1 |India Blue |2 |2 |0 |0 |8 | +0.514 |- style="background-color:lightgreen" |2 |India Red |2 |1 |1 |0 |4 | −0.049 |- |3 |India Green |2 |0 |2 |0 |0 | −0.534 |- |} The top two teams qualified for the final.
